citations.narrative:
A representative from the Lake Superior Zoo informed Animal Care that a juvenile female North American porcupine went
missing from her enclosure. On the morning of July 7, 2024 it was discovered that a hole had been chewed through the
fabric mess netting covering the enclosure and that the female porcupine was missing, but the adult male porcupine was
unharmed. Zoo staff suspect that the female porcupine was likely predated upon by a wild animal, such as a fisher or pine
marten, as the porcupine, which was a rehabilitated animal, suffered from a neurological deficient and would not have
been able to successfully climb and chew her way out of the enclosure. Failure to maintain enclosures that contain and
protect the animals securely increases the risk of injury or death to the animals. All enclosures must be constructed to
securely contain the animals housed within and to prevent injury or harm to the animals. Corrected prior to the time of
inspection. Immediately after the incident, zoo staff repaired the hole in the fabric mess and worked to secure a metal
style mess to replace the fabric mess.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
A representative from the Lake Superior Zoo informed Animal Care that a juvenile female North American porcupine went 
missing from her enclosure. On the morning of July 7, 2024 it was discovered that a hole had been chewed through the 
fabric mess netting covering the enclosure and that the female porcupine was missing, but the adult male porcupine was 
unharmed. Zoo staff suspect that the female porcupine was likely predated upon by a wild animal, such as a fisher or pine 
marten, as the porcupine, which was a rehabilitated animal, suffered from a neurological deficient and would not have 
been able to successfully climb and chew her way out of the enclosure. Failure to maintain enclosures that contain and 
protect the animals securely increases the risk of injury or death to the animals. All enclosures must be constructed to 
securely contain the animals housed within and to prevent injury or harm to the animals. Corrected prior to the time of 
inspection. Immediately after the incident, zoo staff repaired the hole in the fabric mess and worked to secure a metal 
style mess to replace the fabric mess. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
